name: Erdős #340: Greedy Sidon Sequence Growth
description: Let A = {1,2,4,8,13,21,31,45,66,...} be the greedy Sidon sequence. Conjecture: |A ∩ {1,...,N}| >> N^(1/2-ε) for all ε > 0. Best known bound is Ω(N^(1/3)).

insights: Sidon sets (B₂ sequences) are sets where all pairwise sums are distinct
Greedy Sidon sequence: OEIS A005282, also called Mian-Chowla sequence
Axiomatization approach needed since computational construction is complex
DeepMind has formalized Sidon sets but not in Mathlib
Mathlib has asymptotics infrastructure (IsBigO, atTop filters)
Key insight: Sidon property implies distinct pairwise differences (proved via IsSidon.diff_injective)
omega/linarith struggle with Nat subtraction - need explicit Nat.sub_add_cancel in proofs
Don't submit open conjectures to Aristotle - it will spin indefinitely at low progress
Erdős-Turán proof technique: sum differences of order ≤ ℓ where ℓ ≈ N^(1/4)
Best known Sidon upper bound (2025): |A| ≤ N^(1/2) + 0.98183·N^(1/4) + O(1) [Carter-Hunter-O'Bryant]
$500 Erdős prize for proving or disproving |A| ≤ N^(1/2) + o(N^(1/4))
CRITICAL: erdos_340 main theorem is an OPEN CONJECTURE - cannot be proved as statement, only as axiom

sessions.summary: MARKED BLOCKED: The main conjecture erdos_340 (|A ∩ [1,N]| >> N^(1/2-ε)) is an unsolved mathematical problem with a $500 Erdős prize. We proved useful infrastructure (sidon_upper_bound_weak, sidon_lower_bound) but the main theorem cannot be formalized as it hasn't been proved by mathematicians.
Created Erdos340GreedySidon.lean with IsSidon definition, basic lemmas, axiomatized greedy sequence, and main conjecture statement. Aristotle attempting harder sorries.

Proved IsSidon.diff_injective (key lemma: Sidon sets have distinct pairwise differences). Built infrastructure for sidon_lower_bound: orderedPairsLt, pairDiff, sidon_pairDiff_injective, sidon_diffSet_card, sidon_diff_pos_bounded. Documented vision for distributed research platform. Aristotle job stalled at 5% after 110min (included open conjecture).
Proved orderedPairsLt_card via bijection to powersetCard 2 A and Nat.choose_two_right. Added imports for Finset.Powerset and Nat.Choose.Basic. Sorries reduced from 6 to 5.

Proved sidon_upper_bound_weak: if A ⊆ {1,...,N} is Sidon, then |A| ≤ √(2N)+1. Uses sidon_lower_bound (max(A) ≥ n(n-1)/2) and contradiction argument with Nat.lt_succ_sqrt. Note: tighter Erdős-Turán bound (√N + O(N^{1/4})) remains as sorry.

Scouted sidon_upper_bound proof strategy. Erdős-Turán technique requires summing differences of bounded order (j-i ≤ ℓ). Best current bound is N^(1/2)+0.98183·N^(1/4)+O(1) [Carter-Hunter-O'Bryant 2025]. $500 prize still open for o(N^(1/4}) improvement. Infrastructure needed: orderedDiffsByOrder, sum bounds. DeepMind has IsSidon but not the counting lemmas.
